data.question: What are the four new materials synthesized in the study?
What method was used to characterize the synthesized POMOFs?
What application were the POMOFs tested for?
data.answer: Anode materials in lithium ion battery (LIB)

data.question: Which POMOF showed the highest initial and reversible capacity?
What was the reversible capacity of NAU3 at a current density of 100 mA g−1?
What technique was used to investigate the lithium storage mechanisms?
data.answer: Cyclic voltammetry (CV), electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS), X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS), X-ray diffraction (XRD), attenuated total reflectance-Fourier transform infrared (ATR-FT-IR) spectroscopy, and scanning electron microscopy (SEM)

data.question: What factors were identified as influencing the electrochemical performances of the POMOFs?
data.answer: Redox properties of POM cluster anions, coordinated metals centers (Cu+ and Zn2+), and coordination ability between azacycle and Li+

data.question: True or False: The study found that the crystal structure and retention rate of original morphology of POMOFs can partly dominate the diffusion of Li-ion.
What was the role of π-π stacking in one of the POMOFs?
True or False: All synthesized POMOFs showed similar electrochemical performances in the study.
